name: IKEA
sust: Renewable Energy, Energy Saving
info: While IKEA has had a spotty history of greenness in the past with Swedwood's sourcing and toxic chemicals in finished products, the company has made great strides in their supply chain, in powering their stores, and especially in deploying renewable and power-saving technologies into the hands of consumers everywhere at affordable prices.

name: Muji
sust: Material Efficiency, Waste Reduction, Packaging Simplification
info: MUJI was founded in Japan in 1980 as an antithesis to the habits of consumer society at that time. They combat poor-quality, low-priced goods that effect consumption patterns with universally designed, high-quality basics. They are priced above the cheapest brands, but still have an expansive selection of very affordable goods. Their spirit of anti-consumption reaches from their selection of materials, to Muji's processes, to their designs.

name: Live & Sleep
sust: Eco-friendly, Made in the USA
info: Live and Sleep mattresses are developed, crafted and 100% made in the USA. The company makes super-comfortable hypoallergenic, antibacterial and dust mite resistant mattresses that are eco-friendly & CertiPUR-US certified. They believe chemicals, gases, and toxins should be left out of your mattress and your sleep. Live and Sleep uses an open cell memory foam technology that allows air flow, keeping the mattress cool and comfortable for a great night’s sleep. The company offers free shipping and a 100 day trail so you try for yourself.

name: SAATVA
sust: Eco friendly, Made In America
info: Saatva is a leading disruptor in a worn out industry. Saatva creates luxury innerspring mattresses with an organic cotton cover and Euro Pillow top and their model solidly cuts out the middle-man, meaning their mattresses are sold at a fraction of the cost of traditional luxury mattresses. Their disruptive model goes further than distribution, each of their mattresses is made with plant based, eco-friendly materials and is crafted here in America. Their product performs with the best traditional mattress companies across every category, but integrates more ethics and is sold for half the price.

name: Plushbeds
sust: Organic Latex Mattress Line, Made in America

name: 100% Pure
sust: Cruelty-Free, Made in USA
info: 100% Pure aims to create the world’s most pure, organic and all natural line of cosmetics, beauty products and skincare. Their vegan cosmetics are formulated with high performing antioxidants, naturally occurring vitamins and essential oils to give your skin maximum benefits.

name: Herbivore Botanicals
sust: Cruelty-Free, Ethically Sourced Product, Recyclable Packaging
info: Herbivore Botanicals creates natural, cruelty free skincare that’s safe, non-toxic, and highly effective. They believe skincare should smell and feel amazing and add enjoyment to your daily routine. We adore their brand from product to packaging.

name: Alima Pure
sust: Soy-Based Inks on Recycled Paper for Packaging, Carbon Neutral, Refillable Compacts
info: Minimal ingredients for maximum impact. All Alima products are formulated with this in mind. Alima finds the highest quality, purest ingredients, and never use synthetic dyes or tests on animals.

name: RMS Beauty
sust: GMO, Soy, and Nano Free, Cruelty-Free
info: RMS Beauty is based on raw, living and organic principles. Each product is created to hydrate and illuminate skin. RMS Beauty is dedicated to transforming the way women use makeup, creating a product that is not only non-toxic, but that actually heals and nourishes skin.

name: Afterglow Cosmetics
sust: Organic, Gluten Free Makeup

name: SolarCity
sust: Rapidly Deploying Solar to suburbs everywhere, Locally Manufactured Panels, Panel Donation Program
info: SolarCity is probably the best-known solar leasing company since their purchase by Tesla Inc. last year. The company is building its own panel manufacturing capabilities on the east coast, and fighting regulation in Arizona & Colorado that could keep it out of these states. Big business has arrived in the solar market: You can now have clean-energy running through your house while still keeping the same or even lower monthly energy bill.

name: SunRun
sust: Rapidly Deploying Solar to suburbs everywhere

name: Vivint
sust: Rapidly Deploying Solar to suburbs everywhere

name: SunPower
sust: Rapidly Deploying Solar to suburbs everywhere

name: SunGevity
sust: Rapidly Deploying Solar to suburbs everywhere

name: Native Shoes
sust: Environmentally-Friendly Shoes for the Family
info: Native Shoes was founded in Canada back in 2009, with the goal of creating “Future Classics”. They combine casual silhouette style shoes with evolving technology, creating a lightweight, innovative, and future-forward shoe for men, women, and children. Mindful of the environment, they have a low-emission manufacturing process and no animal by-products in their shoes, all packaged with recyclable materials. As far as children’s shoes go, we’ve never seen anything as playful, stylish, and futuristic all in one!

name: Oliberte
sust: Worker’s Rights in Sub-Saharan Africa
info: Known as the world’s only Fair-Trade Certified footwear manufacturing factory, Oliberte is committed supporting worker’s rights in Sub-Saharan Africa. Based out of Addis Adaba, Ethiopia, Oliberte is a sustainably lifestyle brand that employs over 70 staff, the majority of whom are women, to handcraft premium leather and rubber into shoes you’ll keep forever. With a lifetime warranty, they are committed to outstanding customer service, in addition to giving back to the community and environment. They truly do believe in trade, not just aid.

name: The Root Collective
sust: Leather & Textiles Paired Together in Guatemala
info: In a time where products can be mass-produced, The Root Collective wants you to know that everything you buy is made by someone, and they know just who that someone is. Working with shoemakers and textile-weavers in Guatemala, The Root Collective has improved the lives of locals who were in poverty or at-risk of being in gangs. As a certified B-Corp, they believe ethically made shoes can change lives and start a culture of kindness. We’re suckers for flats, and we’re about to stock up on their adorably colored and patterned pairs.

name: Indosole
sust: Ending Tire Waste One Pair of Shoes at a Time
info: By intercepting tires before they ever get to landfills, Indosole stops waste and repurposes old tires into comfortable, casual shoes for both men and women. As a certified B-corp, their durable footwear is artisan-made in Indonesia, ensuring their factories are professional, safe, and healthy for their employees. Summer will be here before you know it - there’s no better time to stock up on a pair of these sandals! Plus, shipping is always free in the US!

name: MOVMT
sust: Ending Tire Waste One Pair of Shoes at a Time
info: MOVMT, or better known as The People’s Movement, takes repurposing plastic to a new level. They pair up-cycled plastic bags cleaned from Bali with natural and eco-conscious materials to create casual shoes and joggers. At extremely affordable prices, their clean, simplistic look is perfect for everyday wear. With over 268,000 tons of plastic debris floating around in the ocean, purchasing MOVMT shoes can help stop waste and start a movement.

name: Veja
sust: Ethical Production, Organic Materials, Zero Waste
info: Veja is a leader in eco and ethical production for athletic shoes. Veja buys organic and ecologically friendly materials from fair trade family farms in Brazil and the amazon, respecting fair trade standards. Based in France, the brand partners with a social charity that helps the disadvantaged reintegrate into society through work. Veja tightly controls its production and only produces orders placed six months in advance. Veja’s packaging is made of recycled and recyclable cardboard.

name: El Naturalista
sust: Eco-Friendly Production & Design
info: El Naturalista keeps comfort and design in mind when creating their lively line of shoes for men, women, and children. In addition, they are committed to using recycled products when necessary, and have recently expanded to include a vegan and chrome-free line. With factories in Spain and Morocco, they believe in economically empowering communities where handmaking shoes are common and a staple of their culture. Our favorites include their colorful Mary Jane’s and chic ankle boots!

name: Nike
sust: Waste Reduction, Renewable Energy Use & Code of Conduct for Manufacturing
info: Nike was outed in the 90s for having a massive sweatshop problem in their supply chain, and the company has worked hard to turn around their reputation since then. Their efforts center around material efficiency with their Flyknit technology introduced in 2012, but the ethics of their contract manufacturers are also being overhauled: 86% now meet Nike's Code of Conduct.

name: Beckett Simonon
sust: Sustainable Production, Made-To-Order, Responsible Production
info: Beckett Simonon is doing things a bit differently - all of their products are custom made-to-order. The brand runs different campaigns each month with just a few products and once the campaign ends, only then do they start manufacturing. This dramatically reduces waste and allows the company to take ethical and sustainable manufacturing seriously. Each product is individually handcrafted by experienced tradespeople in family-owned and operated factories in Europe and South America. You can be sure their products are not only beautiful but also ethically and responsibly made.

name: Charlie Butler
sust: Vegan, 100% Cruelty-Free, Artisan Made
info: Charlie Butler is a trusted source for stylish, sustainable and cruelty-free shoes and boots for both men and women. Each shoe is 100% vegan and handcrafted by artisans in Indonesia. Charlie Butler wants to be worn by vegans and non-­vegans alike and at Charlie Butler, they believe the biggest contribution to preventing animal cruelty is to make great looking shoes for ordinary people that would otherwise buy leather. Backers of Charlie Butler’s new Kickstarter Campaign will be rewarded with a custom-made pair of their very own Charlie Butlers.

name: Lyft
sust: Replacing Car Ownership. Cities built around people vs. built around cars. Very different motivations than Uber.

name: Faraday Bikes
sust: Bringing Electric Bicycles to the mainstream
info: Faraday was originally launched on Kickstarter by alumni of world-renowned design agency IDEO. It's small team that passionately believes that bicycles make the world a better place. Faraday began with a realization – we are surrounded by bicycles, yet so few of us use our bikes as much as we could in our daily lives.

name: Cannondale Contro-E Series
sust: Bringing Electric Bicycles to the mainstream
info: An eBike from one of the most established dealers in ebikes, if you don't trust the startup Faraday. Bosch's electric motor (on this bike) is known as one of the most reliable electric motors.

name: Nissan Leaf Series
sust: Bringing Electric Bicycles to the mainstream

name: Chevy Bolt E
sust: Bringing Electric Cars to the mainstream

name: BMW i Series
sust: Bringing Electric Cars to the mainstream

name: Tesla Motors
sust: Leading Electric Transport, Storage & Generation
info: Tesla Motors was founded in 2003 by a group of engineers in Silicon Valley who wanted to prove that electric cars could be better than gasoline-powered cars. With instant torque, incredible power, and zero emissions, Tesla’s products would be cars without compromise. Each new generation would be increasingly affordable, helping the company work towards its mission: to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable transport.

name: Seventh Generation
sust: Ingredient Disclosure, Toxin Regulation Activism
info: Probably the best known toxin-free brand, Seventh Generation is committed to being the most trusted brand of household, baby, and personal care products for your home.

name: Method Cleaning
sust: Non-Toxic Ingredients, C2C Endorsed Waste-Free
info: San Francisco-based method is the full widget – they've been around since the early 2000's, but have done a lot to bring green cleaning products to a larger audience. From making all their bottles from 100% post-consumer plastic waste, to running their soap factory in Canada on 100% renewable energy, to using as few toxic chemicals as feasible in their soaps, Method is serious business.

name: Planet, Inc.
sust: SCS Biodegradable, Hypoallergic, Cruelty-Free
info: Offers environmentally friendly household products that work. Planet cleaners are hypoallergenic, not tested on animals, free of animal ingredients, and independently certified 100% biodegradable.

name: Molly's Suds
sust: Toxin-Free Products, Manufactured Locally
info: Molly's Suds manufactures earth- and plant-derived laundry, home and pet products that are truly safe for people and the planet. Based around a powerful story, this brand is very serious about toxicity-free product.

name: Wunder Capital
sust: Accelerating Solar Transition w/ Crowd Investment
info: Wunder Capital develops and manages solar investment funds by leveraging its national partnership network, tested processes, proprietary underwriting framework, and best-in-class online investment portal. Wunder actively manages everything, from the sourcing of commercial solar opportunities, to the underwriting, contracting, and construction of each project. Once a system is live, Wunder manages the ongoing operation and maintenance of the array, bills the energy customer, and distributes proceeds to investors.

name: Vanguard FTSE Social Index Fund
sust: Easy disinvestment in companies that don't fulfill FTSE4Good's environmental, social or labor criteria.
info: If you have $3000 lying around, you can find a pre-selected fund of US stocks that meet FTSE4Good's social, environmental and labor criteria. The Fund tracks the FTSE4Good US Select Index, which is independent of Vanguard. The Index includes primarily large- and mid-cap U.S. stocks that have been screened for certain criteria related to the environment, human rights, health and safety, labor standards, and diversity. Currently mostly tech companies, and there are some banks in there that we'd rather not see included. But definitely better than an overall index tracker like VTI.

name: Aspiration Bank
price: 1% APY Checking, You choose (!) your return on investment
sust: Social Bank with High-Yield Checking & Sustainable Investing accounts. Automatic profit-donation.

name: Kiva
price: 0% Return, but finances can be re-lent multiple times
sust: Development, Clean-Energy Access
info: By lending as little as $25 on Kiva, anyone can help a borrower start or grow a business, go to school, access clean energy or realize their potential. For some, it’s a matter of survival, for others it’s the fuel for a life-long ambition.

name: Soylent
sust: Cheap sustainable meals in liquid form: Vegan, Low Impact Synthetic Powdered Food. Donates to World Food Program USA
info: Soylent strives to provide everyone with an affordable means to achieve a healthy lifestyle.  In a world where nearly one billion people do not have sufficient access to affordable food while more than two billion people are overweight or obese – both groups are malnourished. We at Soylent seek to use science, technology, and enterprise as tools to improve the quality and accessibility of nourishing food.

name: Thrive Market
sust: Sustainability & 1-for-1 Social Justice Model, Offers GMO-Free
info: Thrive's mission is to make healthy living easy and affordable for everyone. It is an online superstore with a curated selection of organic and GMO-free products. Additionally, Thrive gives to low-income families for every one of your purchases.

name: Hello Fresh
sust: CO2-Efficient Delivery, Organic Produce
info: HelloFresh aims to provide every household with wholesome home-cooked meals while requiring no planning or shopping. Everything necessary for weeknight meals, carefully planned, locally sourced and delivered to your door. Sounds good to us. As a venture-backed startup available in 9 markets, this is not your local CSA. It is an efficient way to efficiently get healthy produce delivered to your door.

name: Green Chef
sust: USDA organic, eco-friendly packaging, sustainably sourced
info: Green Chef handpicks organic, sustainably sourced ingredients from a trusted community of ranchers, farmers, fishermen, and artisans. Then they prepare and deliver them to you — fresh and pre-measured — along with diverse, chef-crafted recipes. It's an easy way to get sustainable foods in your home by default, pre-measured and ready to cook.

name: Urban Organic
sust: Organic Produce Grown in Brooklyn
info: 14-18 different fruit and vegetables a week, delivered to your door by this great CSA. Pick-up is also available. These CSAs have been around forever, and are the classic option for getting great produce in the city!

name: Solo Eyewear
sust: Funding Eye Care, Recyclable Materials
info: SOLO Eyewear creates environmentally responsible sunglasses that funds eye care (Solo has restored vision for nearly 12,000 people to date), and utilizes recycled and repurposed materials in the construction of its eyewear.

name: Woodzee
sust: Closed Loop Production, Locally Made
info: Woodzee attempts to "combine style and nature" into wooden eyewear, made locally in the USA. Their recycling take-back program gives you 50% off your next pair, which we think is a great first step into truly circular manufacturing!

name: Hemp Eyewear
sust: Biodegradable, Sustainable Materials

name: Warby Parker
sust: 1-For-1 Model, Carbon Neutral (Claim)
info: Warby Parker, as the industry darling of the direct-to-consumer eyewear world, is known for its 1-for-1 model, where the company donates eyewear to some of the world's poorest communities. Less is known about their environmental footprint, though they claim to be carbon-neutral.

name: I Want Proof
sust: Give-Back Program, Sustainable Materials
info: Proof was founded in 2010 by 3 brothers in Idaho, but its roots can be traced back to 1954 when their grandfather, Bud Dame, started a sawmill. The brothers grew up with sawdust in their veins working in the family mill and exploring the Idaho outdoors. The idea to start the brand surfaced in 2010 when founder, Brooks, was trying to create a bamboo ski pole in his garage. The ski pole was a failure, but it planted the seed that would eventually morph into Proof.

name: Monkeyglasses
sust: Biodegradable, Zero Waste, Return Program, Donations

name: Shwood
sust: Sustainable Materials: Wood & Metals

name: Modo Eco Line
sust: Biobased & Recycled Materials

name: Drift Eyewear
sust: Made In Chicago, Upcycled Materials
info: Drift eyewear uses laminated maple temples cut from retired skateboards. Made locally in Chicago, this is not a cheap product, and is only available in Brick n Mortar stores. Their styles are beautiful, their collection extremely well curated. Not available online.

name: American Apparel
sust: Because the whole supply chain is in the USA, waste and energy is used as effectively as possible. American Apparel pays the highest wages, and manufacturer's workers rights are taken seriously.
info: Due to the founder's scandals and problems, American Apparel has earned earned a bad rep. Now under new leadership, we still think this is one of the best go-to companies for sustainable basics. The pieces are affordable, trendy and can be worn anywhere.

name: Elegantees
sust: Fair Trade Certified, Artisan-Made
info: "Elegant tees" and dresses are designed in NYC and sewn by women who have overcome sex trafficking in Nepal. A positive source of income that reinforces independence, a healthy self-image, and confidence restores lives one elegant tee at a time. Elegantees carries super-soft, colorful tees and dresses for a great cause.

name: H&M Hennis Mauritz
sust: Recycling, Manufacturing Ethics
info: Though not at the end-goal yet, H&M has been making strides in sustainability. 3900 stores worldwide now have recycling stations, and H&M has been working to make their manufacturing more ethical. From clean shipping to renewable energy powering 78% operations department, H&M group's sustainability record is still very spotty, but is progressing.

name: Pact Apparel
sust: Fair Trade Certified, Organic Cotton, B Corp
info: PACT apparel is pretty obsessed with making clothes that make the world a better place. The certified B Corp goes to great lengths to make sure their entire supply chain, from the growing and harvesting of the organic cotton to the final sewing and all the processes in between, are as clean and responsible as possible. Their super soft tees, dresses and underwear are 100% cotton. Their non-GMO cotton is great for you and the farmers growing it.

name: Krochet Kids Intl.
sust: Artisan-Made Clothing
info: Krochet Kids is known for their affordable, on-trend clothing, and for the incredible impact they have on the communities where their artisans live and work. The non-profit social impact brand empowers their artisans in Uganda and Peru not only through fair wages, but also through education and mentoring programs. Krochet Kids has developed an extensive monitoring and evaluation system that measures a series of empowerment indicators every month, ensuring that every person in their program is impacted for good.

name: Alternative Apparel
sust: Ethical Production, Fair Labor Association, 70% Sustainable Materials, Green Certified
info: It’s rare to find fashion brands that are both ethical and sustainable, but Alternative Apparel ranks well for both these categories. Alternative respects and values the rights of workers in all countries and believe in the right to fair and safe workplace conditions. Their factories operate in accordance with the Fair Labor Association Workplace Code of Conduct and they make over 70% of their garments with sustainable materials and processes. Alternative is a certified Green Business in LA. We love their LA modern and casual basics for both men and women.

name: Ash & Rose
sust: Fair Labor Practices, Organic & Recycled Materials, Empowering Women
info: Ash & Rose a shop for women who love all things romantic, whimsical, pretty and practical - and care about the planet and the people who inhabit it. Founded by mother-daughter team Nea and Mary Savoca, Ash & Rose has its own private label and a curated boutique of ethical apparel and accessories. The shop is guided by three core values: Sustainability, Fair Labor & Empowering Women.

name: Bead & Reel
sust: Sustainable, Cruelty-free, Ethical Production
info: Bead & Reel believes that fashion and ethics aren't mutually exclusive, offering eco-friendly, cruelty-free, sweatshop-free styles in a one-stop shop for the conscientious woman. Everything they sell meets the criteria of being thoughtful to animals, people, and the world through a carefully curated selection of hand-picked designers and products.They are a 100% vegan, 100% vegan-owned company.

name: Everlane
sust: Ethical Production Process, Radical Transparency
info: Everlane is all about transparency. They spend months finding the best factories around the world—the very same ones that produce our favorite designer labels, and then they build strong personal relationships with factory owners to ensure their factory's integrity and to maintain ethical production practices at every step of the process.They believe customers have the right to know what their products cost to make and where they were made. They reveal their true costs and share the factory and production stories behind each piece of clothing. Their minimal, modern aesthetic makes them a personal favorite!

name: Fair Trade Winds
sust: Fair Trade Federation
info: Fair Trade Winds carries some of the best Fair Trade fashion brands committed to creating clothing in an ethical manner. Each piece of their collection represents the hard work of talented women working in cooperatives where they are becoming empowered and improving the livelihood of their families and communities. Fair Trade Winds is a family owned business with seven brick and mortar locations around the country in addition to their online shop.

name: Indigenous Clothing
sust: Artisan-Made Clothing, Organic & Natural Materials, B-Corp
info: Indigenous Clothing makes and sells organic and fair trade clothing for both women and men. Their ethically made, eco-fashion supports talented artisans around the world. With high-end techniques and attention to detail, each artisan uses their skills to create beautiful clothing. The company uses organic cotton, free range alpaca and low-impact dyes to ensure their clothing has a positive impact on the planet and the wearer.

name: Madefair
sust: Fair Trade Certified Collections
info: MadeFAIR is a one-stop shop for ethical, sustainable, and Certified Fair Trade clothing and accessories. They know that the conscious decision to buy ethically-made products online takes a laudable amount of empathy and awareness to click past the inundation of fast fashion advertisements. MadeFAIR has put together a chic and fashionable collection of sustainable clothing that won't make you compromise your morals or your style.

name: Mata Traders
sust: Fair Trade Federation Member, Organic Selection
info: Mata Traders resists traditional means of factory production by directly hiring fair trade artisans in India and Nepal. Their products are handmade using artistic traditions like block-printing and embroidery to create flattering designs and colorful patterns. They carry a wide range of fair trade clothing and products.

name: Mayamiko
sust: Artisan-Made Clothing, Ethical Trade Initiative Certified
info: Mayamiko works with artisans in disadvantaged communities in Malawi to source and produce their Fair Trade clothing collections. The label started off as a charity, but the idea was always to move on to a 'Trade not Aid' model. The brand now has a loyal base of customers who want to look great and be on trend, but also care about the story of what they are wearing, their health, and the environment.

name: Naja
sust: Artisan-Made Lingerie, Environmentally Friendly Production
info: Naja Lingerie is serious about empowering women. And not just the the women who wear their lingerie. Through Naja's Underwear for Hope program, Naja trains and employs single mothers in Colombia to sew their handmade pieces. Naja’s love for beautifully designed things, rebelliousness, and deep desire to make the world a better place shines through their products. We especially love Naja's eco-friendly line made out of recycled plastic bottles.

name: Nisolo
sust: Artisan-Made
info: Nisolo collaborates with local artisans in Peru from the design to the handmade production of their leather shoes, chukka boots, bags, jewelry and accessories. Nisolo provides fair wages and full-time employment to their artisans and each shoe has heart put into it from every person who works at Nisolo. We love their gorgeously-designed, well made shoes and their fast, free shipping both ways.

name: Patagonia
sust: Fair Trade Certified Collections, Organic Cotton, Environmental Sustainability
info: Patagonia was one of the earliest defenders of environmental ethics in the activewear fashion industry, and one of the first adopters of using recycled materials and switching to organic cotton. Patagonia is expanding its commitment to labor ethics as well by working with Fair Trade Certified factories in India, Sri Lanka, and Los Angeles. This short film by Patagonia shows the positive personal impact fair trade factories have around the world.

name: People Tree
sust: Fair Trade Certified Collections, Organic Cotton Collections, Biodegradable Materials
info: People Tree is recognized by customers and the fashion industry as a pioneer in Fair Trade and environmentally sustainable fashion. For over twenty years, People Tree has partnered with Fair Trade artisans and farmers in the developing world to produce a collection of ethical and eco fashion.

name: Rêve En Vert
sust: Organic, Local, Re-made, Fair Trade
info: Rêve En Vert was founded in response to the evolving nature of contemporary style into something far too consumptive and trend-based. The company is committed to bettering the world through the medium of fashion and lifestyle. Rêve En Vert only features designers who operate their businesses with respect for people and the planet, including organic, re-made, local and fair trade collections of clothing, jewelry, gifts and accessories. Their collections are highly curated to deliver long-lasting style you can feel good about.

name: Shift To Nature
sust: Fairtrade, Organic Cotton
info: Shift To Nature sources the best of eco friendly brands that have a strong commitment to the sustainable and ethical production of beautiful clothing items. Their products are made from certified organic cotton, hemp, bamboo and other sustainable textiles and that are also made through sustainable and ethical fair work production and business practices. You’ll find basics in luxury organic cotton leggings, beautifully made organic cotton t-shirts, dresses in unique luxurious hemp linen, and organic cotton active wear.

name: Symbology
sust: Artisan-Made Clothing
info: Symbology envisions fashion as a platform to empower populations, preserve traditional arts and connect women worldwide. The ethical fashion label fuses artisan textiles made in India with fashion forward designs to create authentic, one-of-a-kind apparel. We love their gorgeous designs, modern aesthetic, and commitment to empowering women across the globe.

name: Tonlé
sust: Artisan Made in Cambodia, Zero-Waste
info: Tonlé’s process starts with scrap waste sourced from mass clothing manufacturers. Using every last thread, they create handmade clothing and accessories signed by their Cambodian artisan makers. They believe style is more than what you wear – it’s what you choose to be a part of. When you buy Tonlé, you're buying one-of-a-kind clothes that carry meaning across cultures and continents.

name: Raven + Lily
sust: Fair Trade Certified, Artisan-Made, B-Corporation
info: Raven + Lily is a socially conscious, fashion and lifestyle brand dedicated to empowering women through design. They produce their clothing, jewelry, bags, accessories and home goods through partnership with at-risk artisan women in 10 countries at fair trade wages. All of Raven + Lily designs are thoughtfully made, and consider the impact on people and the planet.

name: Apolis
sust: Artisan-Made Clothing
info: In 2004, brothers Raan and Shea Parton founded Apolis with a simple idea that business can create social change. Their travels abroad immersed them in personal stories of struggle and survival and inspired them to create a business model that bridges commerce and economic development. Apolis (a-pöl-is) means “global citizen,” and the socially motivated lifestyle brand empowers communities worldwide through artisan made men’s apparel, swimwear, footwear and accessories.

name: Eileen Fisher
sust: Social Consciousness, Fair Trade Certified Collections, Sustainable Materials and Practices
info: Eileen Fisher is quickly becoming an industry leader in ethical and sustainable fashion. They believe social and environmental injustices are a reason to do business completely differently, and carefully oversee their supply chain to ensure fair working wages. By 2020 their vision is to have 100% organic cotton and linen fibers, responsible dyes, carbon positive operations and a no waste facility.

name:
Clean Choice
(previously Ethical Electric)
sust: Source: 99% Wind, 1% Solar generation, verified by Green-E
info: CleanChoice is the officially vetted partner of 350.org, and is as such the most serious and dedicated to sourcing only sustainable energy. Though others like Green Mountain have green plans as well, they also provide more traditional fossil-based plans and so you end up indirectly supporting these types of energy too. CleanChoice has no hidden cancellation fees or shady sales tactics, making them a very reliable partner for energy.

name: Clearview Energy
price:
8.29 c/kWh ($2 savings per month)
$100 early cancellation
sust: The energy comes primarily from gas (47%), offset 100% with RECs*. No certifification available – consumers are asked to trust them.
info: Clearview is a Texas based energy supplier that focuses on green energy – all of their 3 plans are offset with renewable energy certificates*.

name: Green Mountain Energy
sust: Source: 100% Wind Plans available, verified by Green-E. Other plans with only 30% renewable are offered by Green Mountain too.
info: Green Mountain is the biggest clean energy supplier in the US. Their 100% renewable energy plans are very competitively priced, and are the cheapest plans available that are verified by Green-e. Green Mountain has been known to use aggressive sales tactics (who hasn't seen their sales reps hanging out in front of the farmer's market?), and if you do have to cancel a 12-month plan early they do have cancellation fees.

name:
Constellation
(ConEd Subsidiary)
price:
8.49 c/kWh ($0 savings per month)
Unclear early cancellation
sust: From their disclosure: "The electricity supply service includes renewable energy certificates sourced from wind power generators within the United States in an amount equal to 100% of the Accounts’ usage", No Certificates to back this up
info: ConEdison, or Constellation as they sometimes call themselves, have been cleaning up their act by adding renewable energy plans to their selection. They offer green plans that are 100% offset with renewable energy credits, combined with the pricing of one of the largest energy corporations on earth. They do of course have large amounts of fossil energy in their portfolio, so indirectly you will be supporting this as well.
